close_reason:
✅ Completed Phase 1: Collection Types (Elements, Pages)

Implemented in :

## Elements struct
- Collection of Element objects with helper methods
- first : Element? - Returns first element or nil
- last : Element? - Returns last element or nil  
- empty? : Bool - Check if collection is empty
- any? : Bool - Check if collection has elements
- size : Int32 - Get element count
- Array-like access with [] and []?
- Enumerable support with each, map, select
- Literal syntax support: Elements[el1, el2]

## Pages struct
- Collection of Page objects with helper methods
- first : Page? - Returns first page or nil
- last : Page? - Returns last page or nil
- empty? : Bool - Check if collection is empty
- any? : Bool - Check if collection has pages
- size : Int32 - Get page count
- find(selector : String) : Page? - Find page containing element (placeholder)
- find_by_url(js_regex : String) : Page? - Find page by URL regex (placeholder)
- Array-like access
- Enumerable support

## Key Design Decisions
- Used struct wrapper instead of Array alias to avoid conflicts with Crystal's Array methods
- Implements Enumerable for functional programming support
- Provides both bang (!) and optional (?) variants where applicable
- Follows Crystal naming conventions (snake_case)

## Also Fixed
- Updated pdlgen to rename  to  in generated CDP code to avoid conflicts with Crystal's built-in object_id method
- Regenerated all CDP types with fixed property names

## Tests
- 21 examples, all passing
- Tests cover empty collections, element access, iteration, and basic operations

Next: Phase 2 - Basic Page Queries (rod-xkz)

close_reason:
✅ Completed Phase 2: Basic Page Queries

Implemented in :

## QueryOptions struct
- timeout : Time::Span (default 5s)
- retry_interval : Time::Span (default 100ms)
- visible : Bool - Wait for visible elements
- enabled : Bool - Wait for enabled elements

## Page Query Methods
- has(selector) : Tuple(Bool, Element?) - Check existence, returns element if found
- has_element?(selector) : Bool - Convenience boolean check
- element(selector, opts?) : Element - Find single element (raises NotFoundError)
- element_optional(selector, opts?) : Element? - Find element or return nil
- elements(selector, opts?) : Elements - Find all matching elements

## Architecture Improvements
- Moved Elements struct to element.cr
- Moved Pages struct to page.cr
- Eliminated circular dependency between query.cr, element.cr, and page.cr
- Fixed Defaults module class variable type annotation

## Also Fixed
- Fixed browser.cr to use Rod::Defaults::SLOW and Rod::Defaults::TRACE constants
- Fixed Defaults.logger class variable type annotation

## Tests
- 33 examples, all passing
- 12 new tests for Page queries
- Tests cover QueryOptions, has/has_element?, element/element_optional, elements

## Simplified/Stubbed
- element_by_css raises NotFoundError (placeholder)
- elements_by_css returns empty Elements (placeholder)
- Created rod-ane to track full CDP implementation

Next: Phase 3 - Advanced Queries (XPath, Regex, JS) (rod-18n) or implement real queries (rod-ane)

title: Fix Node method generation in Crystal pdlgen ECR templates
description: The ECR template for domain_types.ecr fails to add attribute and attribute_value methods to DOM::Node struct due to scope issues with variable 't'. The template attempts to check if type_name_for_domain(t, d) == 'Node' but 't' is not in scope at that point in the template. Need to fix the template structure to properly generate Node methods or move the logic to the generator.
